title: Non-Violence and Compassion: A Path to Healing in Gaza and the Middle East | Thay Phap Luu
description:
Thay Phap Luu reflects on Thich Nhat Hanh's (Thay's) life and teachings, highlighting his journey from Vietnam and his commitment to engaged Buddhism.

"Thay lived a very remarkable life, and he trained his students to be a continuation of that remarkable life." Thay's resistance to violence and his efforts to unify the Buddhist community in Vietnam, as well as his collaborations with international figures like Martin Luther King Jr., emphasized a shared vision of nonviolent resistance and social transformation. The present situation in Gaza calls for collective healing of intergenerational trauma through mindfulness practice in community.

The talk concludes with a new English translation of a poem by Thay, "Festival of a Thousand Stars," which reflects on compassion and breaking free from the confines of rigid laws. The session closes with a reminder of the joy and transformative power of living and practicing mindfulness in community, embodying the legacy of Thich Nhat Hanh's teachings.

This Dharma talk was recorded from the Ocean of Peace Mediation Hall at Deer Park Monastery on June 9th, 2024.

title: Knowing love, heart is at ease | Br. Pháp Xứ | 2024-02-04
description:
"Knowing love, heart is at ease" is to first know how to love ourselves. Knowing how to love ourselves involves four essential understandings, necessary for finding peace in every moment:
1. Understanding and living mindfully to create miracles. There are three main miracles:
    * Being truly present.
    * Deeply connecting with the ancestral roots to have faith in oneself.
    * Transcending the intoxication of desire and pleasure.
2. Understanding how to radiate compassion to keep your heart always light.
3. Understanding the breaking of ego to attain great freedom and immense love.
4. Understanding the impermanence to cherish every loved one and to live beautifully in every moment.
🍁 Understanding the true meaning of celebrating Lunar New Year, nurturing genuine love for everyone and every living being.

title: Zen and Harry Potter | Sr. Đẳng Nghiêm | Christmas Eve 2023-12-24
description:
From the Ocean of Peace Mediation Hall at Deer Park Monastery.

0:28: Gratitude and celebration for Christmas Eve with the community, expressing thankfulness and support.
11:00: The importance of self-care and well-being in spreading love and peace according to Buddha's teachings.
18:15: The importance of being safe to oneself and finding happiness, illustrated through a Harry Potter story.
24:38: Practice of mindfulness and positive intention through mantras and movements.
32:50: Living in the present moment, not through wishful thinking, is the key to true happiness.
39:33: Practice of peace and kindness towards self and others.
47:42: Embracing fear in relationships, addressing different fears towards others, and transforming actions based on fear.
55:51: The importance of choosing love, peace, and harmony over self-destructive tendencies and protecting the inner child.
1:02:28: Coping with despair through mindfulness and conjuring positive memories to dispel darkness.

title: Hands That Hold: Embracing Presence, Connection, & Gratitude in Every Touch | Bội Nghiêm | 11-26-23
description:
Sister Bội Nghiêm (she/her) skillfully uses the metaphor of hands to remind us to embrace our connections to ourselves, with each other and with the world. She encourages us to hold hands and to come back to our bodies with appreciation. This will enable us to transmit love and gratitude. She also gives us an important teaching: we can transform our feelings from neutral to pleasant through the power of touch.

Integrate these teachings and learn more about how to maintain awareness of feelings: https://deerparkmonastery.org/dharma/deepen-your-practice-mindfulness-of-feelings/

title: Exploring Gender, Perceptions, and Suffering | Thay Phap Dung | 2022-04-17
description:
As part of our in-person Day of Mindfulness, we will hear a Dharma talk from Thay Phap Dung in English. We had a couple minutes of streaming issues near the beginning but the rest is good. 

At the recent Wake Up Retreat, 10% identified as neither male or female. Attendees self-identified as non-binary, fluid, queer, trans, and gender non-conforming. 

Thay Phap Dung explores his experiences and feelings of this reality. He relates it to Buddhist concepts of non-dualism and notions. The Buddha said 100% of our perception is wrong. From here we learn about suchness, representation and mere images

title: The Art of Peace | Su Co Dang Nghiem | 2022-04-03
description:
For this Day of Mindfulness Dharma Talk, we had the theme of Peace. Following our walking meditation for peace, we listened to this talk by Su Co Dang Nghiem. Immediately following was the recitation of the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings, Thay's vision for the sangha. And in the afternoon we watched the new biopic on Thay and held a session of question and answers. 

This recording is the Dharma talk only, but we wanted to offer some context.

title: The Four Kinds of Nutriments and Returning Home | Br. Chân Niệm Hỷ | 2022-01-13
description: During our 2021-2022 90-Day Rains Retreat, the monastics and lay friends practiced separately on Thursdays for a Day of Mindfulness. This teaching was offered on the last Thursday of the retreat by Kenley Neufeld (Chan Niem Hy). The topic is the Four Kinds of Nutriments – edible foods, sense impressions, volition, and consciousness – along with a teaching on how to more easily return home outside the monastery.

title: How to Be Engaged Without Becoming Entangled | Larry Ward | 2021-06-26
description:
The 10th Mindfulness Training is clear: “as members of a spiritual community, we should take a clear stand against oppression and injustice.” Thay’s life and the early history of the Order of Interbeing exemplify that when we only focus on being happy and comfortable, and do not address the root causes of great suffering, we are not embodying our Bodhisattva vows. During this session, presenters will clarify how Thay’s teachings on Engaged Buddhism can guide monastic and lay practitioners in their efforts to live mindfully and joyfully and, also, alleviate the societal suffering resulting from racism, social injustice, environmental destruction, sexual and gender- based violence, and other causes.

This dharma talk was offered for the North American Order of Interbeing Retreat that took place both online and in-person at Deer Park Monastery, Blue Cliff Monastery, and Magnolia Grove Monastery.

title: (Class #14) Mindfulness, Concentration and Insight Include Each Other
description:
(Class #14) The 40 Tenets of Plum Village with Thầy Pháp Lưu: Mindfulness, Concentration and Insight Include Each Other

Dear friends,

In tonight's class Thay Phap Luu will discuss the 14th tenet: 
"Mindfulness, concentration and insight include each other. All three can bring joy, happiness and liberation."

This class is based on a book written by our teacher called "Làng Mai nhìn núi Thứu" or "Plum Village Looks at Vulture's Peak" (an English translation is currently in progress but not yet available). The book describes the essential characteristics of Plum Village practice and teachings. 

For an English translation of the tenets themselves, follow this link: https://orderofinterbeing.org/2016/07/forty-tenets-of-plum-village/

Clase no.14 Los Cuarenta Principios de Plum Village, con el hermano Thay Phap Luu

Queridos amigos,  

En esta clase el hermano Phap Lùù enseña el 14o. Principio: La atenciòn plena, la concentraciòn y la comprensiòn profunda se inter-incluyen. Las tres pueden brindar alegrìa, felicidad y liberaciòn.

Esta clase està basada en el libro escrito por nuestro Maestro Thich Nhat Hanh titulado "Làng Mai nhin nùi Thùu" (Plm Village Observa la montaña Pico del Buitre). Una traducciòn al inglès està en camino pero no disponible todavìa) El libro describe las caracterìsticas esenciales de las pràcticas y enseñanzas de Plum Village.

Para una versiòn en inglès de los Cuarenta Principios de Plum Village, seguir este vìnculo: https://orderofinterbeing.org/2016/07/forty-tenets-of-plum-village/
Una versiòn en español està siendo preparada.

title: Embracing Anxiety and Fear During the Election | Thay Phap Luu | 2020-11-04
description:
How do we embrace and transform ancestral anxiety and fear? Thay Phap Luu leads a guided meditation followed by a talk, on the day after the US election, for a number of local sanghas in California, on how to recognize the fear and anxiety that arises with the unknown. Can we dwell happily in the present moment knowing that we don't know?

Talk begins here: https://youtu.be/dXTfu0na35s?t=828

The talk is followed by a question and answer session: How do we practice when an alcoholic loved one, who has recently stopped drinking and no longer can anesthetize their suffering, lashes out with hurtful words?
